full_summary:
## Anchor System and Float Installation, Blacks Harbour

### Project Overview

Public Works and Government Services Canada is soliciting bids for the installation of an anchor system and floats at Black’s Harbour in the Province of New Brunswick.

#### Project Location
Black’s Harbour Wharf, Charlotte County, New Brunswick

#### Project Scope

The project involves the furnishing of all plant, labour, equipment, and material for the supply and installation of rock socketed steel pipe piles, installation of floating wharves, construction of a reinforced concrete walkway, and supply and installation of electrical and electrical connections at the Black's Harbour Wharf site.

#### Requirements

* Plans and specifications for the project are available for download from the GETS (Government Electronic Tendering System).
* Tenders must be submitted by October 13, 2022 at 13:00 EST.

#### Commercial Terms
The estimated cost of the project is between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000 (HST included). The tendering process is competitive, with the lowest bid selected for award.

#### Procurement Method

The procurement method is a competitive responsive bid process, where all interested suppliers are invited to bid. The tendering procedure will follow the guidelines outlined in the Standard Tendering Documents.

#### Documentation and Specifications

Tender documents can be downloaded from the GETS. Important notes and addenda, when issued, will be available on the GETS website.

#### Delivery and Timeline

The successful contractor is expected to complete the project by March 31, 2023.

#### Contact Information
Edward Johnston (Public Works and Government Services Canada)
 Phone: (506) 343-6382

#### Languages of Communication

The bid shall be prepared in one of Canada's official languages (English or French).

#### Specialty of Work

* Marine construction work

#### Contracting Entity

Public Works and Government Services Canada
11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, Canada K1A 0S5

#### Inquiries

All technical and contractual inquiries should be submitted in writing to Edward Johnston at least five (5) calendar days prior to the tender closing date.

#### Trade Agreement

This tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). The contracting entity reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
